channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: The Intrinsic Manifolds of Radiological Images and their Role in Deep Learning
item.description: These results give a more principled underpinning for the intuition that radiological images can be more challenging to apply deep learning to than natural image datasets common to machine learning research.

item.title: Domain Adaptive Video Segmentation via Temporal Pseudo Supervision
item.description: Specifically, we design cross-frame pseudo labelling to provide pseudo supervision from previous video frames while learning from the augmented current video frames.

item.title: Identifying and Mitigating Flaws of Deep Perceptual Similarity Metrics
item.description: This work investigates the most common DPS metric, where deep features are compared by spatial position, along with metrics comparing the averaged and sorted deep features.

item.title: A Learning System for Motion Planning of Free-Float Dual-Arm Space Manipulator towards Non-Cooperative Object
item.description: Module I realizes the multi-target trajectory planning for two end-effectors within a large target space.

item.title: 3DG-STFM: 3D Geometric Guided Student-Teacher Feature Matching
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, 3DG-STFM is the first student-teacher learning method for the local feature matching task.

item.title: Strong Heuristics for Named Entity Linking
item.description: Named entity linking (NEL) in news is a challenging endeavour due to the frequency of unseen and emerging entities, which necessitates the use of unsupervised or zero-shot methods.

item.title: Compositional Generalization in Grounded Language Learning via Induced Model Sparsity
item.description: We provide a study of how induced model sparsity can help achieve compositional generalization and better sample efficiency in grounded language learning problems.

item.title: No Language Left Behind: Scaling Human-Centered Machine Translation
item.description: Driven by the goal of eradicating language barriers on a global scale, machine translation has solidified itself as a key focus of artificial intelligence research today.

item.title: Towards Counterfactual Image Manipulation via CLIP
item.description: In addition, we design a simple yet effective scheme that explicitly maps CLIP embeddings (of target text) to the latent space and fuses them with latent codes for effective latent code optimization and accurate editing.

item.title: Multi-area Target Individual Detection with Free Drawing on Video
item.description: This paper has provided a novel design idea and some implementation methods to make a real time detection of multi-areas with multiple detecting areas that are generated by the real time drawing on the screen display of the video.

item.title: Chairs Can be Stood on: Overcoming Object Bias in Human-Object Interaction Detection
item.description: To quantitatively study the object bias problem, we advocate a new protocol for evaluating model performance.

item.title: Light-weight spatio-temporal graphs for segmentation and ejection fraction prediction in cardiac ultrasound
item.description: In particular, segmentations of the left ventricle can be used to derive ventricular volume, ejection fraction (EF) and other relevant measurements.

item.title: YOLOv7: Trainable bag-of-freebies sets new state-of-the-art for real-time object detectors
item.description: YOLOv7 surpasses all known object detectors in both speed and accuracy in the range from 5 FPS to 160 FPS and has the highest accuracy 56. 8% AP among all known real-time object detectors with 30 FPS or higher on GPU V100.

item.title: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation through Shape Modeling for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Previous methods proposed Variational Autoencoder (VAE) based models to learn the distribution of shape for a particular organ and used it to automatically evaluate the quality of a segmentation prediction by fitting it into the learned shape distribution.

item.title: GFNet: Geometric Flow Network for 3D Point Cloud Semantic Segmentation
item.description: However, recent projection-based methods for point cloud semantic segmentation usually utilize a vanilla late fusion strategy for the predictions of different views, failing to explore the complementary information from a geometric perspective during the representation learning.

item.title: Tractable Dendritic RNNs for Reconstructing Nonlinear Dynamical Systems
item.description: In many scientific disciplines, we are interested in inferring the nonlinear dynamical system underlying a set of observed time series, a challenging task in the face of chaotic behavior and noise.

item.title: DCT-Net: Domain-Calibrated Translation for Portrait Stylization
item.description: This paper introduces DCT-Net, a novel image translation architecture for few-shot portrait stylization.

item.title: GAMa: Cross-view Video Geo-localization
item.description: There are no existing datasets for this problem, therefore we propose GAMa dataset, a large-scale dataset with ground videos and corresponding aerial images.

item.title: Conditional Distribution Function Estimation Using Neural Networks for Censored and Uncensored Data
item.description: Most work in neural networks focuses on estimating the conditional mean of a continuous response variable given a set of covariates. In this article, we consider estimating the conditional distribution function using neural networks for both censored and uncensored data.

item.title: FAST-VQA: Efficient End-to-end Video Quality Assessment with Fragment Sampling
item.description: Consisting of fragments and FANet, the proposed FrAgment Sample Transformer for VQA (FAST-VQA) enables efficient end-to-end deep VQA and learns effective video-quality-related representations.

item.title: Network Pruning via Feature Shift Minimization
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel Feature Shift Minimization (FSM) method to compress CNN models, which evaluates the feature shift by converging the information of both features and filters.

item.title: Local Relighting of Real Scenes
item.description: We introduce the task of local relighting, which changes a photograph of a scene by switching on and off the light sources that are visible within the image.

item.title: Learning Task Embeddings for Teamwork Adaptation in Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We show that a team of agents is able to adapt to novel tasks when provided with task embeddings.

item.title: Defending against the Label-flipping Attack in Federated Learning
item.description: The label-flipping (LF) attack is a targeted poisoning attack where the attackers poison their training data by flipping the labels of some examples from one class (i. e., the source class) to another (i. e., the target class).

item.title: Accelerating Score-based Generative Models with Preconditioned Diffusion Sampling
item.description: However, a fundamental limitation is that their inference is very slow due to a need for many (e. g., 2000) iterations of sequential computations.

item.title: Pretraining on Interactions for Learning Grounded Affordance Representations
item.description: Lexical semantics and cognitive science point to affordances (i. e. the actions that objects support) as critical for understanding and representing nouns and verbs.

item.title: Transformer based Models for Unsupervised Anomaly Segmentation in Brain MR Images
item.description: The restricted receptive field in CNNs limit the CNN to model the global context and hence if the anomalous regions cover parts of the image, the CNN-based AEs are not capable to bring semantic understanding of the image.

item.title: Learning Local Implicit Fourier Representation for Image Warping
item.description: In this paper, we propose a local texture estimator for image warping (LTEW) followed by an implicit neural representation to deform images into continuous shapes.

item.title: Learning to Accelerate Approximate Methods for Solving Integer Programming via Early Fixing
item.description: Integer programming (IP) is an important and challenging problem.

item.title: RepMix: Representation Mixing for Robust Attribution of Synthesized Images
item.description: Uniquely, we present a solution to this task capable of 1) matching images invariant to their semantic content; 2) robust to benign transformations (changes in quality, resolution, shape, etc.)

item.title: Efficient Spatial-Temporal Information Fusion for LiDAR-Based 3D Moving Object Segmentation
item.description: We also use a point refinement module via 3D sparse convolution to fuse the information from both LiDAR range image and point cloud representations and reduce the artifacts on the borders of the objects.

item.title: CLEAR: Improving Vision-Language Navigation with Cross-Lingual, Environment-Agnostic Representations
item.description: Empirically, on the Room-Across-Room dataset, we show that our multilingual agent gets large improvements in all metrics over the strong baseline model when generalizing to unseen environments with the cross-lingual language representation and the environment-agnostic visual representation.

item.title: Leveraging Trajectory Prediction for Pedestrian Video Anomaly Detection
item.description: Video anomaly detection is a core problem in vision.

item.title: Meta-Learning a Real-Time Tabular AutoML Method For Small Data
item.description: Our AutoML method is meta-learned using the Transformer-based Prior-Data Fitted Network (PFN) architecture and approximates Bayesian inference with a prior that is based on assumptions of simplicity and causal structures.

item.title: Cooperation in regular lattices
item.description: We found that for both Public Goods Games, a consistent trend appears on all two-dimensional lattices: as the number of first neighbors increases, cooperation is enhanced.

item.title: Multi-Label Retinal Disease Classification using Transformers
item.description: First, a new multi-label retinal disease dataset, the MuReD dataset, is constructed, using a number of publicly available datasets for fundus disease classification.

item.title: BiPOCO: Bi-Directional Trajectory Prediction with Pose Constraints for Pedestrian Anomaly Detection
item.description: We present BiPOCO, a Bi-directional trajectory predictor with POse COnstraints, for detecting anomalous activities of pedestrians in videos.

item.title: Detecting and Recovering Sequential DeepFake Manipulation
item.description: Moreover, we build a comprehensive benchmark and set up rigorous evaluation protocols and metrics for this new research problem.

item.title: An Intrusion Detection System based on Deep Belief Networks
item.description: The CICIDS2017 dataset was used to train and evaluate the performance of our proposed DBN approach.

item.title: Array Camera Image Fusion using Physics-Aware Transformers
item.description: We demonstrate a physics-aware transformer for feature-based data fusion from cameras with diverse resolution, color spaces, focal planes, focal lengths, and exposure.

item.title: The StarCraft Multi-Agent Challenges+ : Learning of Multi-Stage Tasks and Environmental Factors without Precise Reward Functions
item.description: This challenge, on the other hand, is interested in the exploration capability of MARL algorithms to efficiently learn implicit multi-stage tasks and environmental factors as well as micro-control.

item.title: PoF: Post-Training of Feature Extractor for Improving Generalization
item.description: We developed a training algorithm called PoF: Post-Training of Feature Extractor that updates the feature extractor part of an already-trained deep model to search a flatter minimum.

item.title: ReMix: A General and Efficient Framework for Multiple Instance Learning based Whole Slide Image Classification
item.description: We evaluate ReMix on two public datasets with two state-of-the-art MIL methods.

item.title: Features Based Adaptive Augmentation for Graph Contrastive Learning
item.description: Self-Supervised learning aims to eliminate the need for expensive annotation in graph representation learning, where graph contrastive learning (GCL) is trained with the self-supervision signals containing data-data pairs.

item.title: Multi-modal Robustness Analysis Against Language and Visual Perturbations
item.description: In this work, we perform the first extensive robustness study of such models against various real-world perturbations focusing on video and language.

item.title: Understanding and Improving Group Normalization
item.description: Various normalization layers have been proposed to help the training of neural networks.

item.title: Distance Matters in Human-Object Interaction Detection
item.description: 2) Insufficient number of distant interactions in benchmark datasets results in under-fitting on these instances.

item.title: Generating Game Levels of Diverse Behaviour Engagement
item.description: Recent years, there has been growing interests in experience-driven procedural level generation.

item.title: Vector Quantisation for Robust Segmentation
item.description: The reliability of segmentation models in the medical domain depends on the model's robustness to perturbations in the input space.

item.title: PRoA: A Probabilistic Robustness Assessment against Functional Perturbations
item.description: Our experiments demonstrate the effectiveness and flexibility of PRoA in terms of evaluating the probabilistic robustness against a broad range of functional perturbations, and PRoA can scale well to various large-scale deep neural networks compared to existing state-of-the-art baselines.
